New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season
Key Match Events: Tyler Oâ€™Neill hit a first-inning homer
Spencer Torkelson hit a one-out single and Zach McKinstry extended his hitting streak to a career-best 11 games with a double
Trey Sweeney drove in two with a double off a fly ball to left field that Rob Refsnyder couldn't play against the wall
Ryan Kreidler and Parker Meadows were picked off first in the seventh
Kreidler retired Triston Casas with a jump throw from foul territory behind third in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Jack Morris threw the ceremonial first pitch to Lance Parrish
The Tigers honored the franchise's 1984 World Series championship
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal's performance was described as fitting for the 1984 night
Alex Cora stated that they need to win the series to catch the Tigers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Comerica Park
The game ended with a score of 2-1 in favor of the Detroit Tigers
Others: Rich Hill, the only player on either roster who was born when the Tigers last won the World Series, made a pickoff throw in the eighth
